Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from three fragments) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim, reserved below; band at top of handle zone, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the high rim suggests that it might belong with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 161)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 655, no. 122)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.092) (Phase 3)
